events.name: Open Tech Community Leipzig Kickoff

venue.name: URBN JUNGLE Leipzig - Raum für urbane Ideen und nachhaltigen Konsum

events.description:
Join us for the birth of something awesome: this meetup kick-starts a new international-minded but locally grown open tech community in Leipzig. It is mainly aimed at bringing everyone together in a friendly and relaxed atmosphere. The meeting is co-organized by Code Camp Leipzig (CCL), Google Developer Group (GDG) Leipzig, and the Leipzig Glocal. It will feature a number of short (lightning-style) talks on technical topics and community vision by the co-organizing institutions, as well as local companies PRISMA, e-dox, and Quajoo and the Open Tech School.
Beer, pizza, and good company is provided gratis and the event is open to everyone. All participating organizations value maintaining a safe environment for everyone and therefore discriminatory or harassing behavior of any kind will not be tolerated (as further elaborated in https://drive.google.com/file/d/1IIRxnQWT3y4fwRw8atvms8c429SLk-Sh/view?usp=sharing).

Doors will open at 5.45pm so you have the chance to get a good seat, grab a drink or have a chat before the talks start.
events.how_to_find_us: If you have questions, you can contact us through simon@codecampleipzig.de, 0177 3001136 or through DMs on meetup.com

events.name: Cloud Study Jam with David Cifuentes

venue.name: URBN JUNGLE Leipzig - Raum für urbane Ideen und nachhaltigen Konsum

events.description:
Join us for our upcoming Cloud Study Jam and get hands-on experience with the GCP Essentials. Be part of a community of like-minded developers and explore the latest Google Cloud technologies as a team.
After the Study Jam, you’ll receive 30-days free access to the entire Qwiklabs catalog, so you can keep developing your skills at home. Complete all the labs in the session’s quest, and you’ll earn an additional free month of access to Qwiklabs as well as a badge for your online profile.

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all the latest versions of popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger.

Agenda

6:00 pm Welcome!
6:05 pm A Tour of Qwiklabs and the Google Cloud Platform
6:50 pm Lab 1: Creating a Virtual Machine
7:30 pm Lab 2: Getting Started with Cloud Shell & gcloud
8:15 pm Break & Networking
8:30 pm Lab 3: Kubernetes Engine: Qwik Start
9:00 pm Next Steps & Thank Yous!
9:05 pm (Optional) Lab 4: Set Up Network and HTTP Load Balancers

A Study Jam is a collective learning program combining practical developer experience with Google Cloud expertise.
Like-minded developers come together to hone their skills and further their cloud knowledge through interactive classrooms and hands-on labs. With over 800 Google Developer Groups around the world, attendees can join a global community of eager-to-learn professionals.

With a Cloud Study Jam, your community members will learn the fundamental tools and capabilities of Google Cloud, share their experiences, and solve hands-on problems together.
Attendees will receive free access to hands-on labs via Qwiklabs, which mirrors a real-life working environment. Choose any of the recommended tracks to run with your community: Machine Learning, BigQuery, Certification, and Kubernetes.
After the session, your members can keep taking labs to earn Google Cloud badges. Continue to grow your community by holding another session and collaborating online.

Free access to Qwiklabs hands-on labs, a $55+ value
Earn Google Cloud badges to show your skills and expertise
No need to register with a credit card
events.how_to_find_us:
The venue is in a little (slightly hidden) passage, on the top floor (up the spiral staircase). If you don't find it, give me a call (0177 300 11 36).
Looking forward to seeing you there!

events.name: Flutter Interact Viewing Party
events.description: Before the year comes to a close, we will have the chance to have a mobile dev event after all. On December 11th, the Flutter Interactive is taking place. While we are not able to participate that very day, we will participate the week after. More information will be announced soon. For now, check out the Flutter Interactive page (https://developers.google.com/events/flutter-interact). Hope to see you there!
events.how_to_find_us:
The room where the meetup takes place is here: https://goo.gl/maps/i9t8Saa7Tjhsq8dX6
If you can't find the event, please give Simon a call (0177 300 11 36) or ask for Christoph Deckelmann.

events.name: Flutter Hands-on session
events.description:
Finally, we are glad to announce the first GDG Leipzig meetup for this year. Less talking and more doing, we decided to have a much more practical session than with the last Flutter-themed meetup we hosted.
In the Flutter hands-on session, Dan will help us get our feet wet with Flutter by building our (first?) own Flutter app. You don't have to have any experience with Flutter (although that also doesn't hurt), but it would be great if you came with a (simple) idea in mind what you want to build (and a laptop, preferably with a Flutter setup prepared, but don't worry if you don't). We'll have drinks and food and build something, together or by ourselves, and have a good time with code and material pleasures.
Hope to see many of you on Friday, the 13th!
If anyone wants to provide their (company) space, we would be happy to have a co-host, if not, we will find a space to host ourselves.
events.how_to_find_us: We will be at Easy APIOMAT GmbH in the City Center. If you can't find it, please contact Jens or Simon (0177 300 11 36)

organizers.name: Daniel M.
